ygData.subject: Re: Troll smithing
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah, but don t get me started on that.  I died like 5 times in one night in Neriak, and had to run back from Oggok every time.  If it wasn t for sprit of
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah, but don't get me started on that. I died like 5 times in one night in
Neriak, and had to run back from Oggok every time. If it wasn't for sprit
of wolf, I'd have probably started another character. You should start
thinking about the trip there too, unless you want to make lanterns from 0
to 80 skill, and only intend on making large banded after that.

I've personally given up on smithing until they actually give us something
to shoot for. I've taken up fletching though. True, you can't make any
money at it, but at least you can be pretty sure you'll have a goal until at
least level 30 or so. That darkwood bow staff and cams to go with it are
expensive (about 450pp just for components if I remember correctly).

Well, off the soapbox...


----- Original Message -----
From: Sturgill, Jim <JimS@...>
To: <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, July 19, 1999 9:22 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ_SMITHS] Troll smithing


> From: "Sturgill, Jim" <JimS@...>
>
> Thanks! Isn't that strange? You would think evil races would get along.
> Bonzz
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Nathaniel Niles [mailto:nniles@...]
> >Sent: Monday, July 19, 1999 12:18 PM
> >To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Troll smithing
> >
> >From: "Nathaniel Niles" <nniles@...>
> >
> >I was an ogre at one time, and I've seen a few trolls killed in Oggok.
> >The
> >only place I actually saw it was in the shaman guild area. Trolls are
> >definitely kos there. I've seen troll bodies in the shadowknight and
> >warrior guilds too, but I'm not sure if trolls are kos in those areas.
> >So,
> >stay out of Komarr's Caves (area J on the map in the EQ guide). I'd
> >actually suggest just going straight to the forge in Metil Armer (area
> >K)
> >and then straight back out the way you came. There's not much else to
> >see
> >in Oggok anyway.
> >
> >
> >----- Original Message -----
> >From: Sturgill, Jim <JimS@...>
> >To: <EQ_smiths@onelist.com>
> >Sent: Monday, July 19, 1999 8:22 AM
> >Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Troll smithing
> >
> >
> >> From: "Sturgill, Jim" <JimS@...>
> >>
> >> Any troll smiths out there? I'm looking to start. Know all the basics
> >> but looking for any troll specific hints like what to avoid in Ogguk
> >> near the forge. Any problems etc.
> >> Bonzz
